intro: Dicrananthera, commonly known as the zigzagged grass or zigzag sedge, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The genus includes several species, many of which are found in tropical and subtropical regions. Dicrananthera plants typically grow in moist, shady environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Their botanical features make them important components of wetland ecosystems and valuable for ecological studies.
